content.content: 1727×624 42.5 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.    Peg864×616 94.7 KB   Some Yuga shakes on late Saturday as ETH plunged, but overall peg solid.   ETH OI1449×523 43.3 KB   ETH opened interest at 7.04 billion and reduced it by a billion and a half over the past week.   DAI Supply1368×746 86.4 KB   DAI supply is below 9 billion.   a slow death march crab market continues, slowly dripping liquidity out as vaults rebalance or pay off debt. Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown.  Vault changes1321×857 147 KB   ETH-A, WBTC-A, and ETH-C remove a chunk of DAI from circulation.   Net burn809×597 45.8 KB   Net burn(-) of 266 million.    Despite rebalancing pains, we only saw seven auctions setting $447K in debt.    WBTC is getting competitive across Defi. See Monetsupply covering this dynamic.    Despite sophisticated responses to the market, as always, DAI supply cohorts are still sticky over the quarter.    Capital at risk overall is 1.73%.    The majority of debt is in a low-risk collateralization category.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  We Are aing for Your Feedback We value your input! Take our survey to let us know what we might be missing or how to do better. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.  Credit @twblack88

Artem_Gordon:   DAI supply is below 9 billion.    Levels of 6 months ago :c     DAI at 6-month-old levels Miscellaneous   [image]  The current bear market, coupled with the recent growth of new stable currencies with high yields, may be the current factor in the current disincentive to use DAI.  @Lozadaluis12 in an internal group we have with @Alefcripto we see several opportunities for growth, but DAO processes may be the factor that can play against.
This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
